Sona BLW Precision Forgings Ltd.published newspaper advertisements regarding their quarterly and annual financial results for the year ending March 31, 2025.

The company announcedQ1FY25 resultswith a revenue of Rs 893 crore, a 22% YoY growth. Revenue from Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV) grew by 53% YoY, constituting 33% of total revenue.

The company has shown strong profit and revenue growth over the past three years, and a good profit growth CAGR over the last five years.

The company is virtually debt-free and has a healthy Interest coverage ratio.

The company significantly decreased its debt by 233.06 Cr.

The company has maintained a healthy dividend payout of 36.5%.

Sona Comstar plans to invest up to Rs 1,000 crore by FY25, primarily to expand its EV business capacity.

The company anticipates the EV segment to contribute up to 45 per cent of its total revenue, an increase from the current 25 per cent.

As part of its expansion plan, Sona Comstar will establish another plant in Manesar, Haryana, to increase differential assembly capacity.

Sona BLW Precision Forgings Ltd announced aJoint Venture formation in China.

Sona Comstar acquired Escorts Kubota’s Railway Business for ₹16,382 million.

The company's interest expenses were less than 1% of operating revenues, and employee costs were 8.88% in the year ending Mar 31, 2025.

The company has an efficient Cash Conversion Cycle and good cash flow management.

The company maintains a healthy liquidity position and ROCE.

The company is trading at a high PE of 51.25.
